result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Banda-Segundo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Probation is revoked, Huber granted for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. All 45 days are to be served in jail.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Attend and complete a domestic abuse alternatives program if and when one becomes available.
Comply with other counseling or assessments recommended by the agent.
No violent or abusive contact with his wife, B.
Submit DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Banda-Segundo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel Banda-Segundo in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Simmons is also present.

2:06 PM Court calls case.
Clerk gives affirmation of interpreter to Karyn Simmons.
Court states appearances.

This matter is set for a plea today.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1, without enhancer.

Atty Schmidt concurs, this is a joint recommendation.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST - Amended Count 1, without enhancer- 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein 947.01(1). domestic abuse assessments are not being implemented in this conviction

Victim is not present.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 45 Days, Imposed and Stayed
If Probation is revoked, Huber granted for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. All 45 days are to be served in jail.
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Attend and complete a domestic abuse alternatives program if and when one becomes available.
Comply with other counseling or assessments recommended by the agent
No violent or abusive contact with his wife, B.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample

20 days in which to appeal the case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 01:45 pm. (Interpreter Karyn Simmons will be present on 04-26-16)
